results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Cherine Fahd (Touch: a family portrait)
results.brief_description:
The 30-second moving image for the Neighbours project is titled Touch ‘ A Family Portrait. It is a portrayal of a family greeting each other on Christmas Eve. The 30-second edit concentrates on the family’s overwhelming display of affection towards each other, their intense ‘kissing’ and ‘touching’. The camera/edits jump from one person to the next, as they kiss from cheek to cheek and affectionately embrace, whilst all speaking at once.

It portrays a multi-racial (Lebanese, Australian, American) family whose affection is displayed and celebrated and whose cultural identity exists beyond the stereotypes of multiculturalism. This piece functions as an antidote or as a somewhat more realistic alternative to the tokenistic portrayal of non-Anglo Australians, in television productions such as ‘Neighbours’.

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Brook Andrew (Hail Amerika)
results.brief_description: The new work for Neighbours (the remix) is obvious in nature. It repeats American logo. In Australia, I find my life pervaded by Amerikanism. My art practice comments on Amerikanisation within Australian and the world culture and mediums, so with all the current world domination attitudes by Amerika, it pops up again. This time like a resounding hammer bashing down hard on the little people who have no power but to listen and bob heads, ‘yes…I do’. Fear is translated through our determination to buy McDonalds and waver in American soapies, news and perspectives.

results.title: Slow Service
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour, silent
results.brief_description:
‘Slow Service’ is a series of portraits shot using a high speed video camera. This camera, which is normally used for filming mine detonations, science experiments and military tests, captures 1000 frames a second. The footage, when played back at 25 frames per second, has been slowed down so that a second of real time takes forty seconds on the screen. ‘I asked the subjects to pose as if for a passport photograph. We see the transition between this artificial pose and their natural instinctive reaction to the bucket of food that is being thrown at them, and then the impact of the food itself.

I liked the idea of capturing a wasteful, slapstick, human gesture using a medium that is normally reserved for ‘serious’ scientists and bomb designers’. (Marcus Lyall, 2004)

results.title: Deakin's pipe dream
results.brief_description:
A montage of archival photographic images superimposed with live action footage to present a vision of Federation and irrigation in the Sunraysia region of Victoria. Without dialogue and accompanied only by background sound effects.
Developed during the Alfred Deakin Federation Project, 2001 and supported by the Centenary of Federation Victoria and the Community Support Fund through the Victorian Federation Grants Scheme, and the Mildura City Council.

results.title: Cultural stories
results.brief_description: There are 140 cultural groups living in Greater Dandenong, Victoria. To celebrate this cultural diversity this short documentary film presents Maria (Hungarian), Andreas (Greek Cypriot) and Rosanna (Chilean) as they each tell their personal story of their own background, family, culture and migrant experience to the sounds of traditional music and images of family photographs.
